p: The percentage compositions of nutritional values in D. dewevrei on dry weight basis show that the leaves and fruits of the plant are rich in carbohydrate and fiber. However, the leaves had more carbohydrate (45.16 ± 2.78) than the fruits (39.07 ± 0.87) while the fruits had more fiber content (49.71 ± 0.80) than the leaves (38.43 ± 2.85). Moisture was found to be more in the fruits (11.57 ± 0.36) than in the leaves (8.81 ± 0.01) of the plant as presented in Figures 1 and 2.
